intro: Dodecatheon pulchellum, commonly known as the showy dodecatheon, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in whorls around the stem, adding to its ornamental appeal. Dodecatheon pulchellum is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
